Subject: Re: [neat] Re: New paper on Evolution Rivaling Backprop

From: Logan Streondj <streondj@...>

-----BEGIN PGP SIGNED MESSAGE-----
Hash: SHA1

Hi David,

I read it, it is very good, especially in its overview of the workings
of GA and NEAT. Only way I think it could be slightly improved is by
also having a description of back propagation as you implemented it,
even if it was the same as usual.

But otherwise good stuff, I tweeted it.

Thanks,
Logan

On 16-05-26 01:35 AM, wei_jok@... [neat] wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi Logan,
> 
> 
> Agree with you that there should be more awareness in GA
> approaches.
> 
> Recently I've wrote a small blog post / tutorial with a simple demo
> that combines a limited version of NEAT with Backpropagation to
> show the world how EA approaches can work:
> 
> Neural Network Evolution Playground with Backprop NEAT | 大トロ 
> <http://blog.otoro.net/2016/05/07/backprop-neat/>  image
> <http://blog.otoro.net/2016/05/07/backprop-neat/>   Neural Network
> Evolution Playground with Backprop... 
> <http://blog.otoro.net/2016/05/07/backprop-neat/> GitHub  View on
> blog.otoro.net <http://blog.otoro.net/2016/05/07/backprop-neat/>  
> Preview by Yahoo
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Maybe will try to create more similar posts going forward.
> 
> David
> 
>
